page.title: 14THE PARKWAY AND TOURISM
page.content:
{The Parkway} On the 1st April 1985 The Parkway was opened.It is a dual carriageway road and was built to link the Tamar bridge which links Devon and Cornwall. The actual traffic jams were at Marsh Mills and they solved it by building a Â£34,000,000 bypass.
{Tourism} Devon and Cornwall are popular tourist areas so in the summer months thousands of visitors come in their cars.With the new Parkway road open, the traffc now moves freely avoiding Plymouth centre,but a bottle neck still occurs at the Tamar bridge. St.Budeaux also has a railway station where the line links Devon to Cornwall via Brunels bridge across the river Tamar built 1859.
